m_DescriptionText.LocalisedValue: This +3 furyborn keen warhammer has a doubled critical threat range. Whenever it threatens a critical hit against a Medium sized creature, it is automatically confirmed. Whenever it lands a hit, the target must make a successful Fortitude save (DC 35) or become staggered for 1 round.
This +4 flaming warhammer holds three small fire elementals that can be summoned once per day for 5 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.

m_FlavorText.LocalisedValue: This warhammer was created out of a fire to release it in time of need.

m_DescriptionText.LocalisedValue: This +4 holy warhammer grants its wielder the ability to cast inspiring recovery {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} once per day as a 11th level cleric.

m_FlavorText.LocalisedValue: This fine piece of equipment was crafted by dwarf Dragn, the {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skillful{/g} blacksmith, appointed a court master.

__root.Comment: Might not fully work due to issue of goblin race fact.

m_DescriptionText.LocalisedValue: This +1 warhammer is particularly efficient against the ancestral enemies of the dwarven {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g}. Its {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is increased by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} against orcs and goblins, and by 2d6 against giants.

m_FlavorText.LocalisedValue: This fine piece of equipment was crafted by dwarf Dragn, the {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skillful{/g} blacksmith, appointed a court master.
The hammer's head is covered in illegible runes.

m_DescriptionText.LocalisedValue: Whenever this +4 anarchic warhammer confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, it applies the effect of {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}Touch{/g} of chaos ability to the target.\nTouch of chaos: You imbue the target with chaos. For the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, anytime they {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} a d20, they must roll twice and take the less favorable result.
This +5 holy warhammer grants its wielder the ability to move without provoking {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.

m_FlavorText.LocalisedValue: The holy weapon of Torag — god of all crafts, especially smithing.

m_DescriptionText.LocalisedValue: Each time this +2 warhammer lands a hit, the enemy must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15) or suffer additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g}.

Whenever this +1 cold iron warhammer confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, all enemies in a 15-foot area must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 16) or become prone.
This +3 warhammer deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d12{/g}+3 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a hit and has a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} range of 19–20.

Whenever the wielder of this +4 warhammer successfully hits an enemy with a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the enemy must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 33) or be entrapped in stone until the end of the fight. While under this effect the enemy becomes vulnerable to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} as well as slowed down. If this warhammer confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an affected enemy, all enemies in a 30-foot area should pass the same {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} or be under the same effect.

Whenever the wielder of this +5 vicious warhammer confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the enemy loses all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}, if it had any, for 1 minute.
This is a +1 cold iron ghost touch weapon.

This is a +3 brilliant energy heartseeker weapon. This weapon can tear the soul of a living enemy: whenever it lands a hit, it deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.

m_FlavorText.LocalisedValue: This weapon was once the seat of Finnean's soul. Now that the soul of the Sarkorian Pathfinder has left the weapon, it has fallen silent forever.
